result.execSummary:
The defendant Tarus Clyde Hill II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 270 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to the sentence that the defendant is currently serving.  Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 year probation.  Probation is also to run consecutive to the sentence that the defendant is currently serving.

Conditions of probation:
-100 days condition time stayed to be used at the agent's discretion.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment.
-No new law violation resulting in a probable cause determination.
-No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
-Absolute sobriety.


Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by 08/17/2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.


Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Tarus Clyde Hill in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
From businesses on behalf of the defendant; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Tarus Clyde Hill in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Program report dated June 19, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Tarus Clyde Hill in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated April 29, 2015 received and filed.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Tarus Clyde Hill not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.   
Case set for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery but no offer. Case is adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Tarus Clyde Hill in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Tarus Clyde Hill in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  On motion of State, Court amended the complaint reflecting correct day of alleged offense.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
